page.title: 17LAND USE
page.content: THE LAND BETWEEN WOOTTON ST. LAWRENCE AND IBWORTH IS PART OF THE HIGH CHALK DOWNLAND OF NORTH HAMPSHIRE,RISING TO A HEIGHT OF OVER 152 METRES.THE LAND IS PREDOMINANTLY ARABLE LAND,GROWING WHEAT AND BARLEY,ALTHOUGH DAIRYING IS ALSO IMPORTANT.ALTHOUGH THERE IS ONLY A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF WOODLAND,THE AREA GIVES A WELL-WOODED APPEARANCE,SINCE MANY SMALL COPPICES ARE MAINTAINED FOR HUNTING.CROPS AFFORDING GROUND COVER,SUCH AS ARTICHOKES,ARE OFTEN GROWN AT THE EDGE OF THE ARABLE FIELDS.THE SETTLEMENTS ARE MADE UP OF FARMS AND SMALL VILLAGES WHICH APPEAR REMOTE,ALTHOUGH ONLY A FEW MILES FROM THE LARGE TOWN OF BASINGSTOKE.
